intro: Mappa tanarius, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and prefers bright, indirect light. Its leaves are velvety and often have a striking coloration, while the flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. Mappa tanarius is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
